title: Don't be blind with the Dark Sovereign.
body:
Ok, her E's bugs have been fixed last patch, but though she needs help. 
Whereas, previously, she could make the difference because of her strong early game, now her early Q does less damage than her basic attacks. 
By the way, she's awfully mana dependant.


As a way to enumerate :
- impossible to do something before her lvl 6, while you can be ganked loads of times,
- farming correctly is way too difficult (Q's damage lowered, mana costs on her all spells),
- you are really slow and squichy as well,
- it is pratically impossible to stun with her E, even if it was improved, if an enemy just sticks you (oh god, dear {{champion:421}}), and still difficult with far-off enemies,
- if the ennemy is stunned luckily, he just has the time to escape, unless you're close to him (therefore, you're exposed, so it's double-edged).


I think I just forgot some others, so just tell me which ones.

There we are.

replies.body: Is that a league of legend champion i almost never see her.

I think Riot intends for Syndra to be weaksauce early on, since her late-game power can be devastating in pro hands. That said, I do agree that her Q could afford to have its cost reduced slightly.

EDIT: Note that when I say Riot "intends" for her to be weak-early/strong-late, that doesn't mean they're doing a good job about it. Yes, she needs reliability improvements, but that doesn't mean they're necessarily going to buff her early game damage.
Quite the opposite. They agreed she's a lane bully, but then deemed her "too strong early" and nerfed just like that.
I thought the problem was that she was supposed to be a late game carry, but she ended up being strong at every point in the game. When that happens they usually nerf the early game.

> [{quoted}](name=CastawayTomHanks,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2015-07-19T16:06:04.523+0000)
>
> I thought the problem was that she was supposed to be a late game carry, but she ended up being strong at every point in the game. When that happens they usually nerf the early game.

Syndra's actually got a somewhat weak late game for a variety of reasons. I know that's weird to say given what her passive is but if they intended her passive to be something to make her stronger than everyone else in the late game, it ended up being just something to stop her falling behind as the game progressed. Her scaling outside of ult is generally mediocre and due to her CC being attached to her basic abilities, she falls off in utility compared to a lot of mages once teamfights are more crucial. Plus, Banshee's is a counter to her ult as with Veigar, who is similar in being a "you'd think he'd be best late but actually no" mage, but less extreme because his AP stacking means he scales quite a bit harder than her.

EDIT: This isn't very relevant to what you said, sorry. But Syndra being quite strong at every point in the game but with a weak late in comparison to some others wasn't the worst power curve in the world. Now that her early is terrible she transitions very poorly to the mid game and naturally falls off in the late game anyway. They turned her from being moderately strong at all points with a focus on the early game to weak at every point, because she needs a strong early to scale at all.

I'd argue that having CC on basic ability is a con.

On the other hand Banshee's only blocks one sphere from her ult.

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=00000000000100000000,timestamp=2015-07-19T16:54:11.761+0000)
>
> I'd argue that having CC on basic ability is a con.
> 
> On the other hand Banshee's only blocks one sphere from her ult.

CC on a basic ability is generally a boon for her, but it's a boon that is mostly felt in laning and early to mid when you are spending a lot more time solo and trading in general. Once you get to the part where everyone is grouped up you start wishing your stun was on your ultimate because it would have a much higher power budget at that point. This is part of why Syndra's scaling is so weird - having CC on your basic abilities is a huge advantage early on, but is far less desirable as the game progresses.

But thanks to that her CC is on a lower cooldown.

Pulling two or three AoE stuns durning a teamfight isn't something to be frown upon.

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=0000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-19T19:00:19.371+0000)
>
> But thanks to that her CC is on a lower cooldown.
> 
> Pulling two or three AoE stuns durning a teamfight isn't something to be frown upon.

I think three is ambitious but yeah, two stuns per team fight isn't bad at all either. Far from guaranteed that a fight will last that long though, considering 40% CDR puts her E on a 7.2 second cooldown.

7.2? considering a fight can last that long, vs mobile assassins, and burst tanks (which even though dying out still exist). Syndra is not only immobile, but positioning to get those 2 stuns off is nearly impossible since there are champs that can smash their way to her :/
well, in the case they should nerf her late game and give her a lane bully
They already hit her late by nerfing Scatter the Weak stun width.

> [{quoted}](name=Yousosmart,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-19T09:12:30.987+0000)
>
> I think Riot intends for Syndra to be weaksauce early on, since her late-game power can be devastating in pro hands. That said, I do agree that her Q could afford to have its cost reduced slightly.

Earlier this month Bjergsen listed her as one of his two 'signature champions' in an interview - when is the last time you saw him play her (or for that matter have seen her been played by _any_ professional player at a competitive level)? When even her main seasoned players can't rely on her to be effective you know there's a problem.

> [{quoted}](name=Ryudo Squirrel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2015-07-19T16:54:27.270+0000)
>
> Earlier this month Bjergsen listed her as one of his two 'signature champions' in an interview - when is the last time you saw him play her (or for that matter have seen her been played by _any_ professional player at a competitive level)? When even her main seasoned players can't rely on her to be effective you know there's a problem.

He played her on stream a week ago or so. He said he didn't think that she was too bad but her mana costs felt a bit too high early game. As for professional play, PowerOfEvil played her twice last split and went 1-1. Clearly not a top tier pick but she's definitely playable.

> [{quoted}](name=Slamurai Jack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2015-07-19T19:32:54.078+0000)
>
> He played her on stream a week ago or so. He said he didn't think that she was too bad but her mana costs felt a bit too high early game. As for professional play, PowerOfEvil played her twice last split and went 1-1. Clearly not a top tier pick but she's definitely playable.

She's a comfort pick for one player and this is the same guy that played Runeglaive Nashor's Orianna.

A champ showing up in the LCS doesn't mean they're good, it just means there is the occasional and very specific scenario that they aren't a bad pick in. Even Elise has shown up this split (and has a 2-0 record), but she's getting pretty hefty buffs next patch.

> [{quoted}](name=Yousosmart,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-19T09:12:30.987+0000)
>
> I think Riot intends for Syndra to be weaksauce early on, since her late-game power can be devastating in pro hands. That said, I do agree that her Q could afford to have its cost reduced slightly.

Pros don't play her anymore because she's considered terrible even by the best players in the game.

Thing with syndra was they decided to nerf her, then 1 week later announced DFG removal, forgetting that that added onto her nerfs would cripple her AT ALL STAGES OF THE GAME. 
If we still had DFG she would be salvageable because the INSTANT SHE HAS THAT ITEM, she is a threat, even if Q didnt hit you for jack

I made a thread about Syndra last month, and I got so much backlash about "Syndra mains" being okay with her. That's complete bs. No one if satisfied with how weak she is. It's a joke. A champion is never 'okay' when they're so dependent on items, that leveling up no longer makes a difference. Damage never needed to be taken from her Q. They should've increased the cd to 5s, dropping down to 4.75 / 4.50 / 4.25 / 4.00 if her early game lane bullying was such a huge problem. That way she'd still have her damage and wave clearing, but can't be as abusive.

Riot's full of it though. They'll gladly keep a close eye on Kalista, but forget about their other champions left in the dust.

> [{quoted}](name=Orianna Reveck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2015-07-19T15:37:08.895+0000)
>
> I feel like one of her bigger problems is that she is shit in this meta. With Righteous Glory and Sivir being a thing, Syndra just gets trampled on. Good positioning can only take you so far these days.

Back when assassins were everywhere she wasn't picked either, and she isn't picked against poke comps. There isn't a single team comp she fits into or counters at the mo.

THIS^
She's getting outclassed by every mid laner pretty much, even the ones she used to counter can easily win against her now.

Well, except LeBlanc and Heimer.

Nothing changed here.

They need to make her W actually do something.
The travel time is insanely slow, the AoE isnt exactly big either.
Also, the god damn range needs to be increased. Right now, a Q-E for a stun brings the sphere out of your W range so u cant grab it. You have to walk like next to the enemy to be in range, and by that time, the stun is already over and the chances of u hitting the w is near 0%

W is her worst skill by far
idek why they nerfed her. she was balanced

I thought how to improve syndra.

At each cast syndra's spells or only dark sphere), all CD are refreshed of X seconds (except ultimate......) 

_or_

Passive grow up with spells'level, not at level 5
_or/and_
Passive buff every spells: dark sphere +15% damage +X range + X% sphere's duration + X area ( maybe nerf at this point, it'll begin to become too "op" ......)

_or_

Add movement speed if drark sphere hit ennemy (like Ahri's illusion sphere maybe) during X seconds 

_or_

ulti will become single targeted area => same ulti but when balls land around the target's area, balls deal damage(not much) at each ennemy present in the area effect.

_or_

dark sphere will detonate at 6 seconds and deal damage in area effect. ( buff more strategic) 

_or_ 

mana costs reduce

_or_

Q damage come back


What do you think? Too "op" or too "trash" ? Comment and enjoy!
They could pull a jayce on her so she get's extra levels on her abilities to make her more late game oriented, I don't think that would work considering her kit though.

Yea but they changed jayce's transformation on R, Syndra doesn't have that and with built in passive like that they would have to completely make a new passive, and change the ordering path of skills on her.
That's why I said it probably wouldn't work considering her kit.

So.... Why talk of jayce's kit and try to adapt on syndra? 
But, transform syndra in Hel (smite. The game) why not?
R will be change syndra = classic skin <=>justiciar skin maybe with news spells in justiciar form :-)

Well if your proposed passive changes to be based off of the spell's level to gradually increase rather than BAM its different at level 5, I think it could work.

I don't like Smite lol, it is so uncomfortable to play with its key layout. It should be controller compatible, otherwise I find it unplayable.
Syndra compare to the lore passive is flawed, syndra's power grow with her, in game at level 9.....

For me smite it's like WoW + LoL, and i like it
I agree with you, at beginning it's complicate to play with.
I play with mouse/ keyboard and i carry often :)
Syndra is fine, she just needs her mana costs lowered and she is balanced, nothing else.

I do agree. However, I enemurate her weak points in my opinion that need to be known to consider Syndra not balanced. As my mid main since one year, I know how was Syndra in 2014 (not OP, just balanced) compared to now.
Obviously, I wouldn't want her to be buffed everywhere ! She still has undeniable strengths.

The thing is, she actually WAS broken in 2014! you could just drop a q next to you, dfg+R+ignite to kill your lane opponent while being a hyperscaling lategame god whilst being a lanebully, sheesh that was fun.
I do however have to say that now they removed dfg i think they should really sit down at Riot in think what they want Syndra to be, Either a earlygame bully with a meh mid game and a bad late, or the other way around, not the cheesy early-mid-lategame goddess that she used to be.

Wrong logic.
It's the item that was broken, not the champion.

Plus I don't know how fed you had to be to 100-0 somebody with only 4-ball ult, DFG or not.

Not fed at all prenerf, just decent farm to get the item considering your opponent would be extremely far behind with your godlike lanebully status. the problem is that as soon as she becomes "decent" again she will become good in every single part of the game, and not just good but godlike without having to do anything for it, just existing.

EDIT: The problem is just her kit, she has far too much lategame and midgame potential for the godlike early game she delivers. I am not saying that if they buffed again she would become an op easy win ban-pick lcs champion but she will be gutted very soon if she becomes popular again in that state.

> [{quoted}](name=TotallynotFrench,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=00030000000100010000,timestamp=2015-07-19T20:40:53.335+0000)
>
> Not fed at all prenerf, just decent farm to get the item considering your opponent would be extremely far behind with your godlike lanebully status. the problem is that as soon as she becomes "decent" again she will become good in every single part of the game, and not just good but godlike without having to do anything for it, just existing.
> 
> EDIT: The problem is just her kit, she has far too much lategame and midgame potential for the godlike early game she delivers. I am not saying that if they buffed again she would become an op easy win ban-pick lcs champion but she will be gutted very soon if she becomes popular again in that state.

God forbid you suggest buffing her late game without improving her currently awful early, then.

Welp she has to be great at one of the three stages of the game, not all of them. I don't mind if they heavily buff her for one stage aslong as they compensate correctly, i'd love for her to be a lategame burst mage to replace Veigar considering it fits greatly with her theme and lore.

> [{quoted}](name=TotallynotFrench,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=0003000000010001000000010000,timestamp=2015-07-19T22:21:28.468+0000)
>
> Welp she has to be great at one of the three stages of the game, not all of them. I don't mind if they heavily buff her for one stage aslong as they compensate correctly, i'd love for her to be a lategame burst mage to replace Veigar considering it fits greatly with her theme and lore.

I don't even understand the concept that a champion only be good at one point. The vast majority of champions have very fluid power curves, particularly mages. A lot of mages have "decent at all points" power curves, if anything Syndra had a more pronounced curve than most because she focused more on the early and had a more meh late.
Because otherwise she will be a literal better version of Veigar, more burst, more cc, more aoe and more range.

> [{quoted}](name=TotallynotFrench,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uRsou1JZ,comment-id=000300000001000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-20T10:41:48.139+0000)
>
> Because otherwise she will be a literal better version of Veigar, more burst, more cc, more aoe and more range.

You are just saying anything you can that says she shouldn't be good. What has Syndra having a moderate power curve got to do with Veigar at all? Like if you want to argue against her being good then fine but at least try and say something relevant. 

They're barely comparable champions. Just because they're the game's primary burst mages doesn't make them identical, not does it make it impossible for both of them to be good at the same time. And I don't see you complaining about Veigar being a literal better version of Syndra right now.

Read all of my previous posts, i am not saying i don't want her to be good, i like her lore and theme, i just think that Veigar and Syndra are far too similiar because of bad old game design    (q poke - w aoe - e conditional cc - r nuclear launch codes)
I'm saying her kit is "badly" designed, that she will either be too weak or too strong with simple number tweaking.

Either one of them has to be stronger then the other, same as morellonomicon and Athene's unholy grail, it's just bad game design.
(Although i would prefer a full on Veigar rework considering his kit doesn't fit him at all anymore whilst Syndra's kit DOES fit.)

And then I wonder why people shun lower ELOs.

> i just think that Veigar and Syndra are far too similiar because of bad old game design (q poke - w aoe - e conditional cc - r nuclear launch codes)

That applies to 90% of champions released since Alpha.

"And then I wonder why people shun lower ELOs."

Oh look, litterally the one thing that makes me want to stop even bothering to try and have a conversation/discussion/whateveritisthatwearehaving with a circlejerking main that thinks it's main is the worst thing since 1931 and should be buffed to pick-ban tier.

"That applies to 90% of champions released since Alpha."

Because we have sooo many Gnar, Rumble, Anivia, Heimerdinger,Jarvan,Lissandra,Vel'koz,Yorick,Zilean,Zyra etc champion copies walking around. Yes not all of them are balanced or fun to play against but atleast they have somewhat original gameplay that no other champion offers.

HeimerDonger litterally makes the lane a tower defence minigame.
Jarvan can Challenge someone to battle him in his arena.
Lissandra is a mage that is primarily focused around small range but great cc.
Vel'koz has to use angles
Yorick has a full summoning kit.
Zilean can revive and has some of the greatest delayed damage in the game.
Zyra can place plants and strategically manipulate them.

Veigar-Syndra = Veigar is an endlessly scaling burst mage that does roughly the same damage as Syndra lategame while not being a lanebully.

You consider ability placement on your keyboard a basis to call something a "bad design".

Do you even read what you write before posting?

Quote ONE sentence in which I say Syndra is the weakest champion in existence.

Please do.

I'm waiting.
Then you'll love similarities between {{champion:104}} and {{champion:236}}

Graves has far more burst but less dps. 
Lucian is also on the burst side but he has more dps then Graves in a full on total fight (considering his ultimate does more damage overall if fully chanelled ((in theory)) and his passive can be nasty with a high ad caster build)
See? You totally ignored similarities other than "_yeah they have burst_", despite them being more alike than Veigar and Syndra will ever be.

What did I just read.

Are we playing the same game?

The only time Syndra was remotely popular was back when she rose as a counter to LeBlanc.

Then nerf she got was:
a. pulled out of an arse
b. about a year after she became "popular" and at least half a year after she stopped.
